intro: Thouinia riparia, commonly known as the river thistle, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows along riverbanks and moist soils, showcasing its adaptability to aquatic environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Thouinia riparia plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in riparian habitats.
